content.question: Which of the following accurately describes the interactions between containers <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi> </math> and <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>?

choices.label: The net result is that energy is transferred from Container <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> to Container <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>.
The amount of energy transferred between the containers depends on the type of atoms each contains.

After equilibrium is reached, the atoms in Container <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> will still have a different average kinetic energy than those in Container <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>.

All the atoms in Container <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> slow down, and all the atoms in Container <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> speed up.

content.answer: The net result is that energy is transferred from Container <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> to Container <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
